answers.author: Richard Hoon
answers.text:
Our Chamber of Commerce functions to unite hundreds of business and professional firms, thus creating a unique central agency working to improve businesses interested in prospecting and creating a healthy environment in which to conduct business.  It also serves as the welcome center.
Our Main Street organization is focused on a more specific area of the City - mainly the downtown core, and serves to provide events, economic development & restructuring activities, downtown design,  and cultivate relationships with orgnaizations with a stake in our historic downtown.
Both are equally beneficial in our community.

answers.author: Pamela Caskie
answers.text:
We struggled with this very issue several times before striking an balance that seemed to work and make sense.  The Chamber of Commerce is a member driven organization that serves to support the needs of its members who may be in any part of the community.    In the Main Street area, they focus on what goes on behind the front doors of the businesses.  The Main Street Organization focuses specifically on the downtown core area and works on what is between the facades (and front doors) of the business.  So how the downtown looks, what signs (in other words business mix) that hang on the buildings, and the overall image of the downtown -- crime, residential value, pedestrian flow, traffic safety etc.  While this separationd doesn't have to occur, but making this delineation, we established roles and expecatations for both organizations, because while they overlap, they are not identical organizations.
